p.content: Adverbs express four basic types of information:
These types have different characteristics as to which positions they may occupy and how they may be modified. Each type will be covered in turn.
Languages normally have degree words which can modify at least some types of adverbs.

case.caseText: does not have any such degree words, however.
on either side (but not both sides) of
before or on both sides of
after or on both sides of
The degree words can modify any type of adverb.
The degree words can modify temporals, locatives, and manner adverbs, but reason or purpose adverbs are not modified.
There are distinct sets of the degree words which can modify each type of adverb.
